title: Header
description: Defines a reusable HTTP header for responses or request components. The header name is derived from its map key — the OpenAPI 3.0 Header Object does not include a 'name' field (use the 'name' attribute as a local identifier only). The 'in' location is implicitly 'header' and must not be specified, distinguishing Header from Parameter.

name.description: Local identifier for this header node. Not an OpenAPI field — the actual HTTP header name is the map key where this Header appears in Responses or Components.

schema.description: The schema defining the type and constraints for the header value

style.description: Serialization style for the header value. Default is 'simple' for header parameters.

explode.description: When true, array/object values generate separate header instances for each element. Default: false.

allowEmptyValue.description: Allows the header to be sent with an empty value.

allowReserved.description: Allows reserved characters in the header value without percent-encoding.

example.description: An example value for the header. Mutually exclusive with 'examples'.

examples.description: Map of named Example objects for the header. Mutually exclusive with 'example'.
